title: SNP spent more on Shetland by-election than Brexit referendum
text:
The Scottish National Party spent more money trying to win a by-election in Shetland than it did on the Brexit referendum.

New figures from the Electoral Commission revealed that the party spent £99,000 on the Holyrood by-election in August, which was just under the legal limit of £100,000.

In the EU referendum in 2016 it spent just £90,000, or less than 13 per cent of the legal limit.

The party’s candidate came second in Shetland - the safest seat in the country - behind the Liberal Democrat’s Beatrice Wishart, despite several visits to the islands by Nicola Sturgeon and her ministers.

Alistair Carmichael, the Lib Dem MP for Orkney and Shetland, said SNP spending on the EU referendum highlighted...
description: The Scottish National Party spent more money trying to win a by-election in Shetland than it did on the Brexit referendum.
